WRITING.TITLE: What to do?
WRITING.TEXT: So, I'm a bisexual girl. I recently got out of a relationship with a girl, due to my crush on this one dude. This crush sprang out of nowhere, but it's pretty intense. I kind of want to pursue, but not yet as it's only been a few days since I've started crushing on him. I'm kind of afraid he won't like me or thinks I'm only attracted to girls. My friends tease him saying "Oh, Crush likes OP!" They don't know I like him though. I share 4 periods with him, and I sit in front of him during lunch. Do I just keep talking, trying to get closer with him? I want to get to know him better. But... There's also a chance I might move over the summer. What do I do?
i agree. i was constantly harassed online when i was 9 (i know, 9 year olds shouldn't be online but i was) because i liked things that people considered cringy.

WRITING.TITLE: New and Old Info
WRITING.TEXT: https://www.reddit.com/r/Crushes/comments/b29y98/what_to_do/?utm_medium=android_app amp;utm_source=share So I'm take one bi girl from earlier. We just got new schedule at school. Now I have 5 out of 7 periods with him. At lunch, we talked together a little. I thought it was really nice because I sit in front of him normally, and we have the same friends, but we talk to each other more than the others. I try my best to wave at him or initiate conversations, which I'm proud of, since with earlier crushes I have not been that confident. I have had like 2 different experiences with crushes. One was when I crushed on my best friend, then one of my other friends told him, and I found out he liked me too. After summer break, he was gonna ask me out, then decided he wasn't into me anymore, so, yay. Another was with this dude. I had this after school thing, and we were split into groups for this. He and my best friend to this day were apart of this group. My best friend helped me confess to him one day, and near the last days of the school year, he gave me a rose and told me he kind of liked me too. Then we grew apart in middle school. So I've had mediocre luck with crushes. They've liked me back, but we've never actually gotten into a relationship. Kind of makes sense, since I was in elementary, but now I think it'll work out better since I'm older or whatever. I've been trying to talk to him more or interact with him. He's pretty funny, and he's a good guy to talk to. Maybe I'll keep you guys posted haha.

WRITING.TITLE: Yeet
WRITING.TEXT: Sometimes I wish I didn't have a crush on him. Other times I love having a crush. But no matter what I want, for now I'll really like him. We've been talking a lot more now, which I'm happy about because I'm actually trying to get closer with him. He's really funny, and a little negative at times haha. We also tend to make eye contact quite a bit when we talk. I actually told someone about my crush, because she said she was going to watch him to see of he likes me. There's a rumor, or joke that he likes me. Today, she told her friends too, which I was cool with. Her friend was speaking really loud though, and said "I knew Crush liked OP!" Which my crush heard, lol. Her friends also said we would be a good couple because we're both funny. Apparently I was blushing a lot, since my friend asked me why my cheeks were so red. Anyway, that's all for today, lol.
Same haha. But my friends don't know I like him so I just act like I have no idea where the blush came from.

WRITING.TITLE: Having a Crush
WRITING.TEXT: I feel I've gotten a crush only because it's like a coping mechanism. Recently I've been incredibly anxious and depressed, and I've been feeling really empty. Having a crush has been giving me hope, a reason to go to school everyday. It gets me through daily tasks and everything. I don't have as many dark thoughts now as I did just a few weeks ago. That's not to say that my problems have gone away, but I've been given a distraction. It's kind of the best thing to happen to me as of late. Does anyone else think or is going through this?
I'm sorry man. I'm scared for summer break and moving for that reason.
That's awesome! I wish you luck, this is a great thing!
I got Depression- 26 Anxiety- 24 and Stress- 34. My goodness! Did not expect that.
There's an app that's called Vent. Used to use it to talk about stuff.
If he finds out and it turns out he's a total homophobe, it'll better for since you'd have dodged a bullet. I'm a bi girl too, so I do understand where you're coming from.

WRITING.TITLE: Being Nihilistic
WRITING.TEXT: I've never been the negative type. Even when I was going through a deep depression, my hopes survived, though it was really hard to keep them up. A lot of my friends are the types that hate everything, or just see no point. They always say stuff like how life has no meaning, but I think it's more you create your own meaning. Life is so different for everyone, not everyone will have the same meaning. That doesn't mean life isn't hard, but that there is something for everyone. I don't know if this is an INFP thing, but I just feel this belongs here. Maybe some of you will agree.

WRITING.TITLE: My Thanatophobia (Might be Triggering)
WRITING.TEXT: I've always had this dread, this horrible fear of the inevitability and eternity of death. My father is an atheist, so he never promoted any idea of a god or heaven. Anytime I had a moment of fear and told him, he told me to think of as sleeping. I know he was trying to help, but it only made the thoughts worse. Would death just be a darkness forever? Never able to experience anything again? Never be able to speak, have fun, do what I want? It brings me so much panic sometimes I can't sleep. It's been like this since I was 6 years old. I've always felt so abnormal about my fear. Everyone seems content with the idea of death. Sometimes they even desire it. I had a period of time where I was suicidal, but this was the only time my fear actually helped me, saving me from killing myself. But that time is over now. Now it only affects me negatively. I hate learning about space. It's so funny; I'm afraid of the sun exploding, despite the fact that I'll be long gone. I remember nearly crying during science class because I was so scared. I wish this fear would go away, but it's not like I can ever face my fear, not unless I can come back to life. That's my experience with thanatophobia. I hope to reach a point where this is finally behind me. I wish everyone else luck with getting over this dreadful fear.

WRITING.TITLE: Scarring
WRITING.TEXT: I've never been diagnosed with dermatillomania, but I feel pretty confident I may have it, or at least some skin issue. I have keratosis pilaris, so I get bumps all over my arms and a little on my legs. I don't really pick at my arms, more like squeezing. It always leaves my skin red and irritated. Recently, I guess I've been squeezing it harder since it's redder. I also pick at chest, face, and back. They all have multiple scars on it from excessive picking. Since I'm still a teen, I get lots of acne normally. I try really hard to stop. But I just can't stop. I don't even realize I'm doing it sometimes, I just get so into it. It's really impacting my self esteem. I've had self esteem issues related to my skin before, as I have scars from self harm that are very apparent. My family don't help either. They've called my arms ugly as well as my beat friend. My dad just thinks of it as a bad habit, and guilt trips me to try to stop. He doesn't think of it as an issue I guess, because he doesn't care enough to try and understand why I pick. My aunt was more understanding, but still, no matter how emotional or powerful of a talk you give me, I won't be able to stop. I've tried so many times with no success. I was wondering about scar healing cream or ways to stop picking when I'm bored at home. Does anyone have any advice? Please, I hate picking at my skin, I don't want my body to be scarred.

Thank you! I have been trying to take care of myself more, so I hope it'll play into helping me stop. Though, I think a big step for me would telling my parents, so I can get professional help too. I have some other problems regarding anxiety, and I hear dermatillomania stems from that. Again, thank you! I really appreciate these methods because using a fidgeting tool never really works as a relapse just comes out of the blue.
Same. My mom would joke that I had a brain tumor if I had a headache, but I took that seriously and didn't sleep that day.
That makes me feel better, knowing I'm not the only one.
Couldn't have worded it better! Love how you described it.

For me it's probably hair and eyes for physical. I love all color hair and eyes. For mental, I like humor and being understanding. I never had a thing for muscular guys, it seems a lot of the guys I like are really skinny haha. I guess I like the more nerdy types too.

WRITING.TITLE: Too Cute
WRITING.TEXT: This dude is just too cute sometimes! I almost squealed in class because of that. He did this weird shaking thing with his hands to get some people to move out of the way, and it was the most adorable thing I've ever seen. Anyway, that's beside the point. I told his friend (Some of his friends are my friends too) that I liked him and now that dude won't stop grinning everytime I'm around my crush. My crush also sat pretty close to me today when my 2nd period teacher was gone, so we had to go to the lunch area. He sat right in front of me, when there were multiple other seats farther away. We also worked on a science project together, since he asked me if I wanted to work together! Heck yeah! We did decent work, even if the computer was barely functioning. We've been talking a lot lately, and I'm glad. Hope that there'll be more progress soon!
Definitely agree. I have naturally dark and thick eyebrows, even been insulted for them. But even so I don't want to make this a trend as it's so unattractive.
I see what you mean. It could look good on certain people with certain faces, but that's not always the case with the people who make their eyebrows fuller or thicker.

Me too! I made a post about this. I used to not care about my acne, my hair, what I wore, how I acted, just didn't care about how I presented. Now I always take time to look good, and it has risen my self esteem quite a bit. I talk more and have made more friends, and I've started going for walks and just have been a lot happier lately. Before I was lonely, depressed, nearly suicidal, and wanted to run away from home. Definitely an upgrade haha.
Same, and people think I'm weird because I wanna go back to school and because I don't want spring break.

What I've done is scroll through my phone and find something interesting, then bring it up or show it to them. It can spark a little chat and maybe learn more about them. Idk, depends how close you are to them.

WRITING.TITLE: Frick
WRITING.TEXT: I told my crush's friend I liked his friend. Now he's always teasing lol. He keeps saying I should tell him or asking my crush to ask me out. So this was like before we were released to go home. I was talking to the dude, and he was saying to tell him. Like really loudly I guess, because another friend came over and asked what we were talking about and why we said "Should I tell him?" Well, it just so happened my crush came over at the same time too. He was like "Ooh tell me what are you talking about?" And I gave his friend the side glare for talking so loud. I just said nothing, but obviously that wasn't true. Then he said if I didn't tell him he wouldn't talk to me forever lol. Didn't tell him, but now I know I gotta be quieter. Or tell other people to be quieter lol. I spent all of my 2nd period talking with him, he always makes me laugh lol. Anyways, that was today! : gt; Wish everyone luck with their crush!

WRITING.TITLE: Fortnite\Fortnite Players are not that bad
WRITING.TEXT: You all probably know the typical 13 year old boy who screeches and gets angry while playing games like Fortnite. Sure, they exist, but again, they're 13. A lot of my guy friends play Fortnite. In real life, off the games, they're really cool, funny dudes. Heck, even I play Fortnite. Right now, I think it's just trendy to hate on Fortnite, because people like it. Anytime anything gets popular, people start hating just because a lot of people like it. It's also just to hate on little kids for no reason. Like come on, they're teens. They're barely grown. They just wanna play games. Sometimes people get heated during competitive games. Fortnite as a game isn't bad either. I like to play it when I'm bored. It's a fun game, and the players and the game don't deserve the hate it's getting right now.
Exactly, since they're actually supposed to be mature enough to be rational.

WRITING.TITLE: I Miss Him
WRITING.TEXT: So I'm on spring break, and I really wanna get back to school, to see my crush and for other reasons too. I've been dreaming about him and just can't stop thinking about him. I really want to talk to him again. The days feel long and I just want them to pass faster. I just feel really bored and wish spring break was over with by now. School's almost over, so I hope I can gain the confidence to confess before it's too late. Wish everyone luck with their crushes too! :)

WRITING.TITLE: Scar healing Cream?
WRITING.TEXT: So my skin is really bad now, I have a lot of scars on my back, face, chest, and arms and it's really damaging my self esteem lately. I can't wear certain things because they're too revealing. Is there any creams you would recommend to make the scars less apparent? I've tried coconut oil, but I've find that it makes my skin really oily and makes me break out, leading to more picking. What do you guys recommend? What has worked for you?

WRITING.TITLE: Habit
WRITING.TEXT: I started self harm at around 10 or 11, and it's progressed a lot throughout the years. Cutting, for me, is just a constant in my life. It's always there for me, if I need it. It's the only stability in my life. I'll always find something to use. Lately, I haven't been depressed. Not the happiest either, but I'm not feeling really bad. But even so, I still cut. Either I've become desensitized to depression that I don't even notice it, or cutting has become so normal that I'll just do it on a whim. Has anyone else felt this? I feel pretty normal, I'm not unhappy. But I still have a lot of urges to cut, sometimes I even subdue to the urges. It's kind of weird.
